results.title: Peruvian plateau
results.brief_description: How primitive methods of mining and transportation have been replaced by modern methods which have helped to increase the wealth obtained from the Andean peaks and plateau of Peru.

results.title: Peru people of the Andes
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explores the Chincheros Valley near Cuzco and contrasts the community life in a self contained Indian Village with that of the tenant farmers who work on the haciendas. Illustrates Peru’s recent economic progress as evidenced in the new mining camps, transportation facilities and the wealth which is concentrated in Lima. (Revision of 1940 film, “Peru”.)

results.title: Perth's Mitchell Freeway
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: The application of the Mitchell Freeway plan to Perth, its immediate advantage in handling growing traffic densities and the long term implications of city development, are seen in their close inter-relationships.

results.title: Personality conflict
results.brief_description: A dramatized example of what happens when two conflicting personalities must work together. Designed to stimulate discussion on the adjustment that supervisors must make, Peter is rather retiring, particular and conscious of his position, His new assistant, Jim, is exuberant and almost aggressively well-meaning. Pete dislikes Jim’s suggestions on altering routines and resents his attitude even more. When he overhears Jim discussing the situation with other men in the cafeteria he is extremely angry, calls Pete into his office and has it out with him. Neither is satisfied and Pete takes the situation to the personnel manager, who tells him it is too late to make a change and that he is capable of making the adjustment. The audience is asked: how should Pete handle Jim?

results.title: Personal presentation skills
results.brief_description: This instructive video provides valuable background on how to prepare a presentation to either a large group or small gathering. Different techniques are described, demonstrated and evaluated in terms of effectiveness. Covers methods such as reading, memorising, impromptu and speaking from notes so that the viewer can gain confidence and give a successful presentation, regardless of level of experience. The underlying values of preparation, knowing your audience and recognising your own style are also outlined.

results.title: Personal hygiene for women. Part 2
results.brief_description: Describes the hygienic measures necessary to prevent the spread of contagious diseases. Shows in an experiment how a cold may be spread. Points out the prevalence of venereal disease, and explains the cause, symptoms, cure, and prevention of syphilis, gonorrhoea, and chancroid.

results.title: Personal Best
results.brief_description: Several young disabled people speak of the barriers caused by general lack of awareness of their needs, and by some people’s prejudices. Disabled people of all ages are then shown participating in a wide variety of activities. Achievement, at a personal level appropriate to the individual, is the dominant theme.

results.title: Persian story
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Photographed during the last few months prior to British evacuation from Abadan, the film shows the magnitude of the Persian oil operations. Shows the barren nature of the countryside, the enormous amount of work done n developing the resources of the oil field, the extent of the pipelines across the desert and the refinery at Abadan, and something of the life of both Persian and British in the refinery city.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ralph Keene, Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
